newsitem.title: CHINA: China opens annual session of parliament.
newsitem.headline: China opens annual session of parliament.

text.p: China opened on Saturday the annual session of its National People's Congress, or parliament with a minute of silence for late paramount leader Deng Xiaoping.
It was the first time for nearly two decades that Deng, who died last week at 92, had not been present or at least an absentee member of the presidium of China's rubber-stamp parliament.

The session opened with a speech by Premier Li Peng, in which it sets a target of 8.0 percent growth and pledges to accelerate reform to force loss-making state enterprises to sink or swim in the market-place.
He also takes a less hardline stand toward Taiwan, after threatening force to recover the island last year, and hails improvements in relations with the United States.
